example.name: literally
example.text: John's teeth rattled in his mouth.

example.name: metaphorically
example.text: It has also rattled Federal's strongly anti-union management, which is already contending with melding far-flung operations and with falling profits.
example.arg: Federal's strongly anti-union management, which is already contending with melding far-flung operations and with falling profits

roleset.name: emit rattling sounds
roleset.note: RATTLE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'rattle' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Framenet classes Communication Noise, Experiencer Object, Perception Noise. Comparison with 'shake' and 'shock'. Verbnet entry sound_emission-43.2, animal_sounds-38. (from rattle.02-v)

example.name: not a snake
example.text: We see, smell and hear slums filled with ``the echoes of hawkers advertising their wares interspersed with abusive language, rattling coughs and the sound of people gathering spittle in their throats and spewing into the street.''

roleset.name: talk continuously
roleset.note: RATTLE_ON-V NOTES: Frames for 'rattle on' is based on sentences in ectb2. Verbnet entry 37.6 (chitchat) was used for framing. Frame created by Jena (from rattle.03-v)

example.text: Old folk this day still rattle on about how the cypress-wood sleeping platforms of Japanese-style houses were long-lasting and hard-wearing *T*...
example.arg: about how the cypress-wood sleeping platforms of Japanese-style houses were long-lasting and hard-wearing *T*

roleset.name: say/list things quickly
roleset.note: RATTLE_OFF-V NOTES: Frames for 'rattle off' is based on sentences in ectb2. Verbnet entry 37.6 (chitchat) was used for framing. Frame created by Jena (from rattle.04-v)

example.text: She can still rattle off a tale or two.
